page.title: 07THE LEE MOOR AREA-EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Apart from the extraction of china clay there is very little else in the way of employment.The company of English China Clays employs over four hundred people in the Lee Moor area. Many of the workers commute from the surrounding areas,more so now than twenty years ago.This process of change is likely to continue,partly because of the lack of facilities,such as schools and shops.There is also the company of Watts,Blake,Bearn who also extract china clay at the Headon China Clay Works.There is little else ,apart from several small farms,a riding stable ,and the post office and shop in Lee Moor village.The company of English China Clays operate a shift system,with shifts covering the morning,afternoon and night.This enables clay to be extracted 24 hours of the day.
